9:I[8003,["972","static/chunks/972-28343adb7a510a09.js","19","static/chunks/19-26574a66b5f58d73.js","308","static/chunks/app/blog/%5Bslug%5D/page-4289f77fd93c919a.js"],""]
a:I[9711,["972","static/chunks/972-28343adb7a510a09.js","19","static/chunks/19-26574a66b5f58d73.js","308","static/chunks/app/blog/%5Bslug%5D/page-4289f77fd93c919a.js"],"default"]
c:I[2972,["972","static/chunks/972-28343adb7a510a09.js","19","static/chunks/19-26574a66b5f58d73.js","308","static/chunks/app/blog/%5Bslug%5D/page-4289f77fd93c919a.js"],""]
b:Tefb,# Boost.space Review: We Spent 30 Days Testing This "Zapier-Airtable Hybrid"

**Source: Hands-on testing + 80+ real user reviews | Last updated: February 2026**

---

## Hook: The Integration Tool Nobody Asked For (But Everyone Needed)

I spent three years building workflows in Zapier. Spent another two drowning in Airtable bases. So when I first heard about Boost.space—a tool claiming to be the "love child" of both—I rolled my eyes. Hard.

Here's the thing, though. After running actual automations through it over 30 days, I'm not rolling my eyes anymore. As one Reddit user put it: "Boost.space is essentially a wrapper around Make.com." And that's not entirely wrong. But it's also not the whole story.

The real question isn't whether Boost.space is original. It's whether it solves your problem better than the alternatives. And for a specific type of user—the one tired of paying $50/month for Zapier just to move data between a spreadsheet and a CRM—it might.

**Our score: 7.8/10** (after 30 days of real use)

---

## What Is Boost.space & Who Is It For

Boost.space connects 2,000+ apps while giving you a built-in database to store and transform data. Think of it as Make.com's engine wrapped in Airtable's interface—at half the price.

**Who it's for:**
- Small agencies (10-50 clients): ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ 
- E-commerce operators: ⭐⭐⭐⭐
- Freelancers tired of Zapier pricing: ⭐⭐⭐⭐
- Enterprise needing SSO: ⭐⭐ (limited)

---

## Pricing: The Real Numbers (Feb 2026)

| Plan | Monthly | Records | Automations | Best For |
|------|---------|---------|-------------|----------|
| Free | $0 | 1,000 | 100/mo | Testing only |
| Mini | $9 | 10,000 | 5,000/mo | Solo |
| Basic | $29 | 50,000 | 25,000/mo | Small teams |
| Pro | $79 | 200,000 | 100,000/mo | Agencies |
| Business | $149 | Unlimited | 500,000/mo | Enterprise |

**Real comparison** (10K records + 10K ops):
- Boost.space: **$29/month**
- Zapier + Airtable: **$69/month**
- **You save ~$480/year**

**Hidden costs:**
- Overage: $0.001-0.005 per extra run
- File storage limits apply

**Source:** Official pricing (Feb 2026), user-reported data

---

## Real Pros & Cons

### ✅ Actually Good

1. **One tool instead of two** — Database + automations genuinely integrated
2. **Cheaper than Zapier/Airtable** — User-reported 30-40% savings at scale  
3. **Faster learning than Make.com** — Non-technical team adopted in ~2 days

### ❌ Actually Bad

1. **Not truly real-time** — 30-60 second delays (marketing says "real-time")
2. **Mobile app is weak** — iOS rated 3.2★, limited functionality
3. **Depends on Make.com** — If Make changes API terms, Boost breaks

---

## What Real Users Say

**From Trustpilot (4.8/5, 100+ reviews):**

> "Zapier and Airtable had a baby and named it Boost space. Saved me from many mistakes with two-way sync." — 5★ review

> "Better than competition at half the price. Like if Make merged with SQL." — 5★ review

> "Spent 18 hours to setup 3 automations. Learning curve is real." — Still gave 5★ for potential

**The complaints:**
- Support can be slow (4 days response time reported)
- Dashboard uses 20%+ CPU
- UI looks "designed in 2018"

---

## Final Verdict

**Use it if:**
- You pay for both Airtable + Zapier now
- Workflows are data-heavy
- Budget is primary concern

**Skip it if:**
- You need sub-second sync
- Mobile management is critical
- You want a 5-year stable tool (it's newer, riskier)

**Bottom line:** Boost.space isn't revolutionary. It's evolutionary—and that's fine. It packages proven concepts cheaper and simpler. For the right user, that's enough.

**Score: 7.8/10**
- Value: 9/10
- Ease: 8/10  
- Features: 7/10
- Reliability: 7/10
- Support: 6/10

---
